verses.text: 所羅門定意建殿所羅門決意要為耶和華的名建造殿宇，又為自己建造王宮。

words.note: Verb-object compound referring to temple construction.
Abbreviation for 列王紀上 (Book of 1 Kings).
Auxiliary verb indicating intention or future action.
The Hebrew name for God.
Often refers specifically to a temple in biblical contexts.
Common phrase in Bible commentaries or study Bibles.
Refers to the authoritative Hebrew and Aramaic text of the Tanakh.

verses.text: 於是，所羅門選派了七萬人作挑夫，八萬人在山上鑿石，三千六百人作督工。

words.note: Verb-object compound, specific to quarrying or stone work.
Can also be a verb: to supervise work.
Common phrase in Bible commentaries or study Bibles.
Refers to the authoritative Hebrew and Aramaic text of the Tanakh.

verses.text: 所羅門派人去見推羅王希蘭說：「你怎樣待我的父親大衛，給他運來香柏木，為他建造宮殿居住，請你也這樣待我。

words.note: Combines the place 'Tyre' (推羅), the title 'King' (王), and the personal name 'Hiram' (希蘭).
A type of wood frequently mentioned in the Old Testament for construction.

verses.text: 現在我要為耶和華我 神的名建造殿宇，分別為聖獻給他，在他面前焚燒芬芳的香，經常擺上陳設餅，每日早晚、安息日、初一，以及耶和華我們的 神所定的節日，都獻上燔祭；這是以色列人永遠的定例。

words.note: Auxiliary verb indicating intention or future action.
The Hebrew name for God.
Reverence space used in Chinese Bibles.
Often refers specifically to a temple in biblical contexts.

words.definition: to consecrate, set apart as holy
words.note: An idiom specifically used for religious consecration.
Refers to fragrant offerings in religious contexts.
Specific loaves of bread kept in the Tabernacle/Temple, a biblical term.
The day of rest and worship in Judaism and Christianity.

words.definition: New Moon, first day of lunar month
words.note: In biblical context, refers to the New Moon festival.
The Hebrew name for God.
Reverence space used in Chinese Bibles.
Used before a verb to form a nominal phrase or indicate passive voice.
A type of sacrifice completely consumed by fire, common in the Old Testament.
Refers to established laws or regulations, especially in a religious context.

verses.text: 我要建造的殿宇必須宏偉，因為我們的 神偉大，超過眾神之上。

words.note: Auxiliary verb indicating intention or future action.
Often refers specifically to a temple in biblical contexts.
Reverence space used in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to other deities besides the one true God.
Often functions as a postposition indicating 'above something'.

verses.text: 但誰能為他建造殿宇呢？天和天上的天也容不下他；我是誰，怎能為他建造殿宇？我不過在他面前燒香罷了。

words.note: Refers to a grand building, often a temple for deity.
Refers to a grand building, often a temple for deity.
Here refers to a religious offering or act of worship.

verses.text: 現在請你派一個巧匠到我這裡來，他要精於使用金、銀、銅、鐵和紫色朱紅色藍色線工作，並且懂得雕刻，好與我的父親大衛在猶大和耶路撒冷預備的巧匠一同工作。
又請你從黎巴嫩運送香柏木、松木和檀香木到我這裡來，因為我知道你的臣僕善於砍伐黎巴嫩的樹木；我的臣僕可以和你的臣僕一同工作。

words.note: Refers to subjects/servants of a ruler.
Refers to subjects/servants of a ruler.
Refers to subjects/servants of a ruler.

verses.text: 給我預備大量的木材，因為我要建造的那殿宇，將會十分宏偉。

words.note: Refers to a grand building, often a temple for deity.

verses.text: 至於你的僕人，就是砍伐樹木的人，我必給他們食物，就是小麥四百萬公升、大麥四百萬公升、酒四十萬公升、油四十萬公升。」
推羅王答應相助推羅王希蘭回信給所羅門說：「耶和華因為愛自己的子民，所以立你作他們的王。」

words.note: Abbreviation for 列王紀上 (Book of 1 Kings)
The Hebrew personal name of God
Refers to the people of a nation or king, esp. God's people.

verses.text: 希蘭又說：「創造天地的耶和華以色列的 神，是應當稱頌的！因為他賜給大衛王一個有智慧的兒子，有聰明有見識，可以為耶和華建造殿宇，為自己建造王宮。

words.note: The preceding space/character is often used for reverence in Bibles.

verses.text: 現在我派一個技藝精巧、滿有聰明的人來，他是我父親希蘭的匠人。

words.note: Often used to describe a person's qualities.

verses.text: 他是但支派一個婦人的兒子，他的父親是推羅人。他精於使用金、銀、銅、鐵、石、木，以及紫色藍色朱紅色線和細麻作工，也能作各樣雕刻的工作，又能設計各樣交託他們的巧工。這人可以和你的巧匠，以及我主你父親大衛的巧匠一同工作。

words.note: One of Jacob's sons, head of a tribe of Israel.

verses.text: 我主所說的小麥、大麥、酒和油，請派人運來給眾僕人。

words.note: Used before verbs to form a nominal phrase, like 'that which is said'.

verses.text: 我們必照著你所需要的，從黎巴嫩砍下樹木，紮成木筏，從海上運到約帕，你可以從那裡把它們運上耶路撒冷。」

words.note: Introduces a nominalized verbal phrase.
Introduces object before verb in 'ba' construction.

verses.text: 選派工人所羅門按照他父親大衛數點的數目，又數點了住在以色列地所有的外族人，他們共有十五萬三千六百人。

words.note: Abbreviation for '列王記上'.
Refers to non-Israelite peoples.

words.definition: one hundred fifty-three thousand six hundred

verses.text: 他選派七萬人作挑夫，八萬人在山上鑿石頭，三千六百人作監工，督促人民工作。
